title: Just a tip for champs listed ?

replies.body: Easy tip, narrow your champ pool, you simply play too many things in every role to actually be adequate with any of them
im asking for tips my champ pool is fine I don't see a prob I was listing the champs I play

As i said for someone not devoting the bulk of their life onto LoL you simply cannot be proficient at all those champions, doesn't mean never play them but your champ pool should be 3-5 champs for main role and 2-3 for each role besides that AT MOST, with champs overlapping (example some mids can support ie Annie, some Jgs can top lane ie Pantheon) it is just not feasible for someone not playing 10-12 hours a day to be proficient at all those champs

Especially with the number of mechanically very complex champs you play.

ADC: Draven, Ez

Mid: Yasuo, Zed, Ahri, Akali (to ane xtent)

Top: RIven, Nidalee

Jungle: Lee Sin, Rengar

Now of those mechanically difficult champions you have all 4 of the most mechanically intense in the game to play to their full potential, Riven, Zed, Lee and Draven, those champs on their own (meaning one of them) would take a very long time to master for pro players, let alone someone who has a job/school or just someone who's livelyhood isn't tied to the game. Again I am not saying never play these champs just that to truly improve and be able to grasp the concepts of these very difficult champs you need an insanely good grasps of the game itself before even trying to make these part of your consistent champ pool.
lmao I never said I master them like I said I was listing the champs I play I have no idea why u would think I mastered all of them it even says tips like bro -_-

With {{champion:102}} you should harass the enemy laner by using the combo E W Q. This allows you to deal extra damage from the E, more ms from the W and a double hit from the Q. Keep on doing this until  the enemy is low. If you feel like diving with your R or just killing him/her then make sure you can do it without dieing.
thanks but already knew about it :D

{{champion:75}} as long as they push the lane, you win :D
odds are the lane will naturally push if you give up some cs, usually when u make the decision to stay healthy or cs.. youre gonna miss some
bait abilities = makes them push lane, look exposed but pull out.. realy helpful against your so-called "counter" Riven
Pretend to go up for a cs, she tries to Qs yu but you just back off, she Q's your minions, the wave pushes.. gg you just won

freeze the lane, even if u can 1 shot a minon with Q, dont doooo thaaat.. you're gonna push too much
prevent THEIR minions from getting into your turret range, as long as you dont get killed doing it
usually taking minion aggro and lead them away from the tower
or just tanking minion shots so they cant advance any further
I have a leona tip, go ham.
Play passively with Kat until you get ult cx
